data.title: TotalEnergies CEO says Europe should negotiate with US for free trade of LNG
data.description:
TotalEnergies CEO Patrick Pouyanne said on Wednesday that European countries should negotiate to obtain a free trade guarantee on liquefied natural gas (LNG) from the United States.

The comments come as U.S. President Donald Trump imposed sweeping tariffs on Chinese imports, which led to Beijing imposing a 15% levy on U.S. LNG and 10% on U.S. crude oil in retaliation on Tuesday.

Speaking to reporters after the company announced fourth quarter earnings, Pouyanne added that LNG export capacity in the United States should practically double in coming years.

"But what happens if all of a sudden the U.S. decides they must export less than they've done historically? ... We must not pass from a so-called over-dependence on Russia to an over-dependence on another country, even if it's an ally," Pouyanne said.

"There are two types of countries: those with free trade agreements that the Americans have signed and under which they cannot suspend exports, and then countries without free-trade agreements, like Europe."

"I think it would be good for Europeans to ask the Americans in the negotiations that are to come, for a sort of free-trade guarantee on LNG," he said.

data.title: German Services Sector Growth Unrevised at 6-Month High
data.description:
The HCOB Germany Services PMI rose to 52.5 in January 2025, up from 51.2 in December, matching the preliminary estimate.

This indicated an acceleration in business activity to its fastest pace in six months, just below the long-term average, despite a marginal drop in new orders.

However, price pressures intensified, with inflation rates for both input costs and output charges accelerating to their fastest pace since early 2024.

data.title: German Private Sector Activity Grows for 1st Time in 7 Months
data.description:
The HCOB Germany Composite PMI was revised up to 50.5 in January 2025 from a preliminary reading of 50.1 and 48.0 in December, marking its first expansion in seven months as services expanded (PMI at 52.5) and manufacturing declined at a slower pace (PMI at 45).

The increase was mainly driven by businesses completing outstanding orders, while new demand continued to fall, though at a slower rate than in previous months.

Employment declines also eased, with job creation returning in the service sector.

Business confidence improved across both industries.

However, inflationary pressures strengthened.

Costs for businesses rose at the fastest pace in nearly two years, driven by higher expenses in services and stabilizing manufacturing input costs.

As a result, companies raised their selling prices at the steepest rate since February 2024.

data.title: ITMAX System Bags Government Deal For Smart Parking Operation
data.description:
ITMAX System unit Southmax won a deal from the Majlis Perbandaran Pontian to operate the latter's outdoor parking spaces, according to a Wednesday Malaysian bourse filing.

The deal has a term of 15 years, from Feb. 1, 2025, until Jan. 31, 2040.

data.title: Italy Services Activity Growth Slows
data.description:
The HCOB Italy Services PMI came in at 50.4 in January 2025, slightly below December’s reading of 50.7 and market forecasts of 50.5.

New orders declined for the third consecutive month, with firms citing weaker demand and heightened customer uncertainty.

Export orders also fell sharply.

In response, Italian service providers reduced staffing levels during the month, ending a two-month run of job growth.

The weakness in demand led to a further drop in backlogs of work, marking the sixteenth consecutive month of decline.

Regarding prices, both input cost inflation and charge inflation rose to nine-month highs.

Although still in positive territory, business confidence about the 12-month outlook for activity fell to a 15-month low and was noticeably subdued by historical standards.

data.title: Parametric pollution insurance launched for Delhi construction workers
data.description:
(The Insurer) - Reinsurance broker K M Dastur and insurer Go Digit General Insurance have launched a parametric insurance product covering construction workers in Delhi for wage losses during pollution-induced work bans.

The Migrants Resilience Collaborative was also involved in the product. Construction workers in Delhi are often migrants from other parts of the country working for a daily wage.

To tackle pollution, authorities can impose a ban on non-essential construction activity if an air quality index passes a certain threshold, which occurred most recently in November last year.

The parametric insurance product pays claims to workers if the air quality index exceeds a certain threshold for three days within a five-day period, with payouts of up to INR6,000 ($69) per policy period.

"Delhi’s air pollution crisis isn't just an environmental issue – it’s an economic and social challenge impacting thousands of migrant construction workers exposed to hazardous conditions every day," said Ayandev Saha, climate risk adaptation and insurance lead at K M Dastur, in a LinkedIn post.

In another post, he added: "A first-of-its-kind parametric insurance ensures automatic direct payouts when AQI [air quality index] crosses critical levels. Launched by Migrants Resilience Collaborative and K M Dastur Reinsurance Brokers Pvt. Ltd., underwritten by Digit Insurance (Go Digit General Insurance), this innovation strengthens climate resilience and financial inclusion."

data.title: Bank Indonesia May Cut Rate at February Meeting — Market Talk
data.description: Bank Indonesia may cut rates by 25 bps in 1Q, bringing its policy rate to 5.50%, likely at its February policy meeting, as it prioritizes postpandemic easing, Barclays economist Brian Tan says in a note. Despite stable 4Q GDP growth, policymakers are expected to remain focused on reversing previous rate hikes, he notes. With USD/IDR stable around 16,300, another cut is likely, he reckons. Inflation softened in January, prompting a downward revision to Tan's 2025 average inflation forecast to 1.4% from 1.7%, below BI's 1.5%-3.5% target. If electricity discounts are extended beyond February, inflation could fall further, strengthening the case for continued monetary easing, he adds. (yingxian.wong@wsj.com)

data.title: Muthoot Capital Services' Net Profit Rises in Fiscal Q3
data.description:
Muthoot Capital Services said its net profit rose to 125.6 million Indian rupees in the fiscal third quarter from 100.1 million rupees a year ago, according to a Tuesday filing with the Indian exchanges.

Earnings per share during the quarter ended Dec. 31, 2024, climbed to 7.63 rupees from 6.09 rupees a year earlier.

Total revenue from operations in fiscal Q3 increased year on year to 1.26 billion rupees from 959.6 million rupees, according to the filing.

data.title: Credit Agricole shares rise on strong Q4 performance
data.description:
** Shares in Credit Agricole rise 2% after the French banking group's stronger than anticipated Q4 performance

** Barclays analysts highlight Q4 net profit that was 28% above consensus, driven by gains in asset gathering and corporate centre, even with retail banking underperforming

** Credit Agricole's CET1 ratio was in line with expectations at 11.7% and ahead of its own target of 11%

** Dividend per share of 1.10 euros also slightly exceeds forecasts, adding to the positive sentiment, Barclays says

data.title: Oil Falls Despite Trump Reimposing 'Maximum Pressure' on Iran — Market Talk
data.description: Oil prices edge lower in early trade despite U.S. President Trump ramping up pressure on Iran. Brent crude is down 0.7% to $75.68 a barrel, while WTI falls 0.6% to $72.25 a barrel. Trump signed a directive restoring his "maximum pressure" campaign on Tehran with the aim to stop the country from obtaining a nuclear weapon. Stricter enforcement of sanctions could put as much as 1 million barrels a day of oil supply at risk, according to ING analysts. "However, reduced flows from Iran will not help in lowering oil prices, something that President Trump is very keen to achieve," they say. "He would need to see OPEC increase oil output to offset any potential Iranian losses." Prices are pressured by fears that a trade war between the U.S. and China could hurt global growth and increase inflationary pressures, damping demand for crude. (giulia.petroni@wsj.com)

data.title: Malaysia Shares Rise 0.6%; U.S.-China Tariff Fight Could Cap Upside — Market Talk
data.description: Malaysia's benchmark Kuala Lumpur Composite Index ended 0.6% higher at 1574.51 amid bargain hunting. However, continuing concerns about rising U.S.-China trade tensions, fueled by the latest round of tit-for-tat tariffs, could limit further upside in the local benchmark's rebound, TA Securities analyst Stephen Soo says in a note. The KLCI could find support at 1550 and face resistance at 1605, he adds. Among gainers, Gamuda added 4.8% and YTL Power International rose 4.3%. Meanwhile, QL Resources lost 1.1% and SD Guthrie was 0.6% lower. (yingxian.wong@wsj.com)

data.title: KGHM Polska Miedz Identifies Possible Impairment For Several Subsidiaries
data.description:
KGHM Polska Miedz SA :

  • IDENTIFIES POSSIBLE IMPAIRMENT FOR SEVERAL SUBSIDIARIES

data.title: Street View: Alphabet's AI spending to squeeze margins
data.description:
** Alphabet said on Tuesday it will spend $75 billion on its AI build-out this year, 29% more than Wall Street expected, and investors signaled disappointment at a missed cloud revenue target and began showing impatience over profitability

** Shares down 7.3% to $191.4 in premarket trading

SAILING THROUGH GREY CLOUDS

** Citigroup ("buy," PT: $229) says increased capital expenditures will impact free cash flow and earnings, however, with Search AI Overviews live in many countries, they expect sustained Search growth

** Morningstar (fair value: $237) believes GOOGL's operating margins will remain flat over the next five years as costs from AI investments rise

** D.A.Davidson ("neutral," PT: $200) sees more pressure on margins due to cloud infrastructure expansion

** RBC ("outperform," PT: $235) says that while the impact of AI on GOOGL will be widely debated, co is actively advancing its AI efforts and, this proactive approach aligns with broader industry trends

data.title: Russia's net forex sales rise to equivalent of 5.6 bln roubles per day
data.description:
Russia's finance ministry said on Wednesday it would cut its purchases of foreign currency and gold in the month ahead, a move that will increase the state's overall forex sales, providing support for the rouble.

The finance ministry said its purchases of foreign currencies and gold for the period from Feb. 7 to March 6 would amount to the equivalent of 66.5 billion roubles, or 3.3 billion roubles a day.

In the previous period from Jan. 15 to Feb. 6 the purchases amounted to the equivalent of 70.2 billion roubles, or 4.1 billion roubles a day.

The move implies that the overall net forex sales by the government and the central bank will rise to 5.56 billion roubles per day from Feb. 7 from 4.76 billion roubles previously.

data.title: Banco Santander to Launch EUR1.6 Billion Share Buyback
data.description:
Banco Santander will on Thursday start its 1.59 billion-euro share buyback program, which is scheduled to run until June 27.

The Spanish lender plans to repurchase up to 1,413,743,296 shares as part of its share capital reduction plan, according to a Wednesday filing.

The program will take place on the Spanish Automated Quotation System, Turquoise Europe, DXE Europe, and Aquis Exchange Europe.

data.title: KB Financial Group 2024 Net KRW5.029T, Up 11% >105560.SE
Carlsquare/Vontobel weekly trading note: Investor uncertainty over Trumps tariffs
data.description:
Orange juice prices have been at record highs since 2022 but have been falling since September 2024. Two regions, Sao Paolo in Brazil and Florida in the US, dominate global production and supply. Here, bad weather, a strong US dollar and Brazilian real, and citrus greening disease have contributed to the price trend. We recommend going long when the price has fallen a little further from current levels. Since Friday 31 January, global equity markets have been negatively affected by President Trump's tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China.

Uncertain demand, coupled with production problems in both Florida and Brazil, halted the previous linear price increase for frozen concentrated orange juice (FCOJ). In 2024, Hurricane Milton was devastating to Florida citrus production. In Brazil, excessive drought and high temperatures, combined with citrus greening, have significantly affected production. If demand remains weak, it is possible that prices will follow seasonal patterns and remain subdued in the coming months. On the other hand, Trump tariffs and a strong USD and BRL could artificially boost prices in both directions. A potential investor could enter a long position when the orange juice price touches one of the lower barriers discussed in the article.

US President Trumps proposed tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China made the equity markets tumble on Friday 31 January in the US, followed by a similar reaction on the Asian and European stock markets on Monday 3 February.

Please find out more in our weekly letter on certificates Vontobel.com: Read the weekly newsletter here

Link to the Swedish-translated version

Read more

data.title: MEXC Fuels DeFi Innovation and Liquidity Security with the Berachain (BERA) Listing
data.description:
VICTORIA, Seychelles, Feb. 05, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — MEXC, the world's leading cryptocurrency trading platform, announced the listing of the Berachain (BERA), scheduled for February 6, 2025, at 13:00 (UTC). The launch on MEXC will be accompanied by Airdrop+ rewards of 19,100 BERA and 50,000 USDT.

Berachain: From Meme to EVM-Identical Layer 1Berachain began as a meme, inspired by bear-themed JPEGs, and has since evolved into the creation of an innovative blockchain. It is a Layer 1 network that is both EVM-compatible and powered by a unique Proof of Liquidity (PoL) consensus mechanism. With this mechanism, validators not only stake tokens but also provide liquidity. Through its Proof of Liquidity (PoL) model, Berachain leverages active liquidity providers to secure the network, effectively turning capital into a core security resource.

This groundbreaking approach has attracted significant financial backing, with the project raising $142 million in its latest funding round. As of January 2, the Berachain official website reports that 234 protocols are actively participating in its bArtio Testnet. BERA is a gas token, used for transactions and staking within its ecosystem.

Berachain, powered by the BeaconKit modular consensus layer and built on the Cosmos SDK, offers flexibility for Ethereum-based blockchains. It enables developers to create both Layer-1 and Layer-2 solutions without needing to rewrite programming languages. Recently, Berachain launched Boyco, a pre-launch liquidity platform in collaboration with Enso and LayerZero, designed to address the cold start issue for new decentralized applications. Boyco's pre-deposit vaults have already reached $2.2 billion.

Celebrate the BERA Launch with a prize pool of 19,100 BERA & 50,000 USDTIn a significant show of support for Berachain and its expansive ecosystem, MEXC is set to list the new BERA token. This move not only underscores MEXC's commitment to pioneering blockchain projects but also connects users with a dynamic network that fuels cutting-edge initiatives.

MEXC, known for quickly listing trending tokens, expands its offerings with Berachain (BERA). The BERA/USDT trading market officially launched in the Innovation Zone on February 6, 2025, at 13:00 (UTC), followed by the introduction of the BERA USDT perpetual futures at 13:10 (UTC), offering adjustable leverage from 1x to 50x with both cross and isolated margin modes.

To celebrate the listing of Berachain (BERA) on MEXC Spot and Futures on February 6, MEXC is launching a series of exclusive activities starting on February 5, 2025, at 05:00 (UTC). Participants will have the chance to win BERA tokens, USDT bonuses, and other exciting rewards, with opportunities available for both new and experienced users.

These activities include:

  • Event 1: Deposit and Share 14,000 BERA (New User Exclusive)

Deposit at least 15 BERA or 100 USDT to qualify.

Trade BERA Spot ($100) or trade BERA Perpetual Futures ($500) to earn 2 BERA each, limited to 3,500 users per activity, on a first-come, first-served basis.

  • Event 2: Spot Challenge — Trade to Share 1,000 BERA (Open to All Users).
  • Event 3: Futures Challenge — Trade to Share 50,000 USDT in Futures Bonuses (Open to All Users).

The top 2,000 users with trading volumes over 20,000 USDT will share the reward pool, with individual rewards of up to 5,000 USDT.

  • Event 4: Invite New Users and Share 4,000 BERA.
  • Event 5: Spread the Word and Win 1,00 BERA Rewards

Your Easiest Way to Trending TokensMEXC aims to become the go-to platform offering the widest range of valuable crypto assets. The platform has grown its user base to 30 million by providing a diverse selection of tokens, high-frequency airdrops, and simple participation processes. In 2024, MEXC launched a total of 2,376 new tokens, including 1,716 initial listings and 605 memecoins, with total airdrop rewards exceeding $136 million.

About MEXCFounded in 2018, MEXC is committed to being "Your Easiest Way to Crypto". Serving over 30 million users across 170+ countries, MEXC is known for its broad selection of trending tokens, frequent airdrop opportunities, and low trading fees. Our user-friendly platform is designed to support both new traders and experienced investors, offering secure and efficient access to digital assets. MEXC prioritizes simplicity and innovation, making crypto trading more accessible and rewarding.

data.title: UK's Aptitude Software Group rises on "good start to 2025"
data.description:
** Aptitude Software Group jumps as much as 6.3% to 337.5p; among top pct gainer across London

** Finance software solutions provider says recent weeks saw "renewed momentum" after challenging macroeconomic conditions slowed customer decision-making in 2024

** Says annual recurring rev from its AI autonomous finance solutions up 12% y/y on a constant currency basis

** Adds co had good start to 2025 after winning a 5.7 mln pound ($7.1 mln) contract last month from top U.S. health insurer

** Stock gained 21% in 2024

($1 = 0.7997 pounds)

data.title: China Sees Growing Number of Private Pension Funds Sales Agencies by End-2024
data.description:
The number of fund sales institutions for private pensions in China rose to 52 as of the end of 2024, up from 37 as of the end of 2022, Xinhua News reported Monday.

Data from the Asset Management Association of China showed that 19 commercial banks comprised the total, with the remainder consisting of 25 securities companies and eight independent sales institutions, according to the report.

data.title: Italian Private Sector Contraction Continues in January
data.description:
Italy's private sector activity remains in the contraction territory in January amid a slowdown in service expansion and a further decline in manufacturing output.

The HCOB Italy Composite PMI Output Index was unchanged month over month at 49.7, Hamburg Commercial Bank and S&P Global said Wednesday.

On the services side, the PMI was 50.4, below the prior 50.7 and the consensus estimate of 50.5.

data.title: India's Symphony slumps nearly 9% after swinging to quarterly loss
data.description:
** Shares of Symphony Ltd slump 8.6% to 1,305.45 rupees

** Air cooler manufacturer swings to loss in Q3 on lower revenue and slightly higher costs

** SYMP posts first loss in at least 4 years - LSEG data

** Stock was down 2.6% before results

** Around 1 mln shares traded in stock's busiest session in about 4 months vs 30-day avg volume of 101,000 shares

** Analysts tracking SYMP rate it "hold" on avg - data compiled by LSEG

** Stock swings to YTD loss of 3%

data.title: Ugandan shilling flat, to firm due to commercial bank dollar sales
data.description:
The Ugandan shilling UGX=> was unchanged on Wednesday and was seen firming, helped by commercial banks trimming their long dollar positions, traders said.

At 0834 GMT, commercial banks quoted the shilling at 3,675/3,685, the same level as Tuesday's close.

data.title: Final PMI: French Private Sector Slump Eases in January
data.description:
France's private sector output further declined in January, albeit at a slower pace from a month ago, final data from S&P Global and Hamburg Commercial Bank showed Wednesday.

The HCOB France Composite PMI Output Index came in at 47.6, up from 47.5 but below the flash estimate of 48.3.

On the other hand, the services PMI tumbled to 48.2 from 49.3, against the initial reading of 48.9.

data.title: USPACE Technology Group's Unit to Co-Host Satellite Exhibition
data.description:
USPACE Technology Group said its subsidiary Aspace Satellite Technology has agreed to co-host an exhibition event of its 100 satellites in different countries with the International Astronautical Federation, a Tuesday Hong Kong bourse filing said.

The exhibition is aimed at the promotion, popularization, and awareness of innovative achievements in industrialized satellite manufacturing.

data.title: Czech retail sales growth strongest since 2022
data.description:
Czech retail sales climbed by 6.2% year-on-year in December, posting the strongest rise in almost three years, statistics office data showed on Wednesday.

The pace of growth picked up from 4.2% year-on-year in November and was more than 2 percentage points above a Reuters poll forecast.

Revived consumer demand has been the main growth driver for the Czech economy, as for other central European countries, as soft demand from euro zone trade partners weighs on the region's manufacturers.

"(The data) confirms the combination of low inflation and solid nominal wage growth... creates a favourable environment for the revival of retail sales and household consumption in general," Radomir Jac, chief economist at Generali Investments CEE, said.

Czech retail sales have climbed each month since December 2023 after falling for around a year-and-a-half before that as high inflation crushed demand. The rise in December was the biggest since January 2022.

In month-on-month terms, retail sales increased by 1.2% in December, the statistics office said, giving a rise for the full-year 2024 of 4.6%.

The Czech National Bank meets on Thursday and analysts expect it to renew interest rate cuts after it paused the easing cycle in December due to lingering inflation pressures, especially in the services sector.

The bank has cut its main rate to 4.00% from 7.00% since late 2023.

Inflation in December accelerated less than expected, to 3.0% year-on-year, which helped increase bets on another rate cut. Preliminary price data for January will be published on Thursday morning, before the central bank's rate decision.

data.title: Major Gulf markets ease as Trump's Gaza remarks spark concerns
data.description:
Major stock markets in the Gulf were subdued in early trade on Wednesday, reacting to U.S. President Donald Trump's stunning statement about taking control of the war-ravaged Gaza Strip and revamping its economy once Palestinians are relocated elsewhere.

The announcement followed Trump's shock proposal for the permanent resettlement of the more than two million Palestinians from Gaza to neighboring countries, calling the enclave - where the first phase of a fragile Israel-Hamas ceasefire and hostage release deal is in effect - a "demolition site."

Saudi Arabia's benchmark index eased 0.1% in choppy trade, with SABIC Agri-Nutrients Company losing 2.6%.

The kingdom rejects any attempts to displace the Palestinians from their land and would not establish ties with Israel without the creation of a Palestinian state, Saudi Arabia's foreign ministry said.

The United States had led months of diplomacy to get Saudi Arabia, one of the most powerful and influential Arab states, to normalise ties with Israel and recognise the country.

Dubai's main share index lost 0.2%, hit by a 1.1% fall in blue-chip developer Emaar Properties .

In Abu Dhabi, the index fell 0.1%, with the country's biggest lender First Abu Dhabi Bank ahead of its earnings announcement.

The United Arab Emirates' foreign trade touched 3 trillion dirhams ($817 billion) for the first time by the end of 2024, Prime Minister and Dubai ruler Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum said in a post on X on Wednesday.

Meanwhile, the UAE's non-oil private sector continued to expand robustly at the start of 2025, although capacity pressures and competitive challenges posed headwinds, a survey showed on Wednesday.

The Qatari benchmark lost 0.3%, with the Gulf's biggest lender Qatar National Bank dropping 0.5%.

data.title: MotorK Announces Lower-Than-Expected Q4 and FY 2024 CARR
data.description:
MotorK Announces Lower-Than-Expected Q4 and FY 2024 CARR

LONDON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--February 05, 2025--

Regulatory News:

MotorK PLC (AMS: MTRK) ("MotorK", the "Group" or the "Company"), a leading SaaS provider to the automotive retail industry in the EMEA region, today announced that its Committed Annual Recurring Revenues(1) (CARR) for the fourth quarter 2024 and the full financial year 2024 are lower than previously expected.

European automotive uncertainty and macroeconomics have influenced decision-making among large retailers and manufacturers, impacting MotorK's CARR in two key ways:

  • Several high-value deals originally expected to close by year-end 2024 have been deferred into 2025 and remain under negotiation.
  • Client-signed and yet-to-be-delivered deals have experienced delays or have been subject to renegotiation.

In response, MotorK has adopted a more conservative criteria of CARR to better reflect the evolving business environment. This adjustment has resulted in a reduction in reported CARR, with deals that no longer meet the revised criteria being reclassified into the company's pipeline. As a result:

  • MotorK's CARR for the fiscal year ending 31 December 2024 are expected to be approximately 15% below the guidance of EUR 45-50 million, as previously communicated.
  • MotorK's sales pipeline exceeded EUR24 million on 31 December 2024, reinforcing the company's strong commercial momentum and future revenue potential.

MotorK remains confident in its long-term growth strategy and continues to execute on its commitment to driving innovation and delivering value to its customers and shareholders.

Forward-looking information and disclaimer

This press release may include forward-looking statements. Other than reported financial results and historical information, all statements included in this press release, including, without limitation, those regarding our financial position, business strategy and management plans and objectives for future operations, may be deemed to be forward-looking statements. Without limitation, any statements preceded or followed by or that include the words "targets", "plans", "believes", "expects", "aims", "intends", "anticipates", "estimates", "projects", "will", "may", "would", "could" or "should", or words or terms of similar substance or the negative thereof, are forward-looking statements. These forward-looking statements are based on our current expectations, projections and key assumptions about future events and are subject to risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from those expressed in the forward-looking statements. Many of these risks and uncertainties relate to factors that are beyond MotorK's ability to control or estimate precisely, such as future market conditions, the behavior of other market participants and the actions of governmental regulators. Readers are cautioned not to place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements, which speak only as of the date of this press release and are subject to change without notice. Other than as required by applicable law or the applicable rules of any exchange on which our securities may be traded, we expressly disclaim any obligation or undertaking to update or revise publicly any forward-looking statements, whether because of new information, future events or otherwise.

Important information

This press release contains information within the meaning of Article 7(1) of the Market Abuse Regulation (596/2014).

ABOUT MOTORK PLC

MotorK (AMS: MTRK) is a leading software as a service ("SaaS") provider for the automotive retail industry in the EMEA region, with approximately 400 employees and ten offices in seven countries (Italy, Spain, France, Germany, Belgium, the UK, and Israel). MotorK empowers car manufacturers and dealers to improve their customer experience through a broad suite of fully integrated digital products and services. MotorK provides its customers with an innovative combination of digital solutions, SaaS cloud products and the largest R&D department in the automotive digital sales and marketing industry in Europe. MotorK is a company registered in England and Wales. Registered office: 5th Floor One New Change, London, England, EC4M 9AF - Company Registration: 9259000. For more information: www.motork.io or investors.motork.io.

(1) Committed ARR ("CARR") includes ARR and Committed Recurring Revenues ("CRR"). CRR refers to signed contracts to be delivered and billed. Annual Recurring Revenues ("ARR") are defined as the yearly subscription value of the customer base at the end of the reporting period.

CONTACT: FOR FURTHER INFORMATION

data.title: Kingkey Financial International Extends the Completion Date for Completing Proposed Acquisition
data.description:
Kingkey Financial International (Holdings) extended the completion date to Feb. 11 to allow for the completion of its proposed acquisition of the target company's sale shares, according to a Tuesday filing with the Hong Kong bourse.

Initially, four business days were needed after fulfilling conditions on Jan. 24 to allow more time for administrative procedures. All other terms of the agreement remain unchanged.
